title: Compare velocity of two position functions

content.question: Two particles start at the origin and move along the x-axis. For <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CA6@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, their respective position functions are given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>x</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D17@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo>=</mo><msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msup> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3ED1@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. For how many values of t do the particles have the same velocity?

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
